Author : Robin Camarasa

Institution : Erasmus Medical Center

Position : PhD student

Contact : r.camarasa@erasmusmc.nl

Date : 2019-12-09

Project : src

File that contains the code to convert data to torch tensor

data_science_framework.pytorch_utils.data_manager.data_conversion.convert_nifty_batch_to_torch_tensor(patients_images: list, device: str) → torch.Tensor[source]¶

Function that converts a nifty batch to a torch tensor

Parameters

  • patients_images – List of list of nifty images loaded by nibabel

  • device – Name of the device (cpu or gpu)

Returns

Torch tensor attached to the required device

Project : baseline_unet

File that contains the codes that implements data transformations

data_science_framework.pytorch_utils.data_manager.data_transformation.apply_transformations_to_batch(input_batch: list, gt_batch: list, transformations: list) → Tuple[source]¶

Function that applies transformations to a batch of images

Parameters

  • input_batch – Input images of the batch

  • gt_batch – Ground truth images of the

Returns

the updated input batch and gt batch

data_science_framework.pytorch_utils.data_manager.data_transformation.crop_half_images(input_images: list, gt_images: list) → Tuple[source]¶

Function that crop the half of the image containing non null ground truth

Parameters

  • input_images – List of input nifty images

  • gt_images – List of ground truth nifty images

Returns

The modified input images and the modified gt images

data_science_framework.pytorch_utils.data_manager.data_transformation.flip_images(input_images: list, gt_images: list, flip_x=False, flip_y=False, flip_z=False, random: bool = False)[source]¶

Function that flip images

Parameters

  • input_images – List of input nifty images

  • gt_images – List of ground truth nifty images

  • random – Boolean that is true if the transformation is aleatoric

  • flip_x – Boolean that is true if function flips image along x axis

  • flip_y – Boolean that is true if function flips image along y axis

  • flip_z – Boolean that is true if function flips image along z axis

  • random – True if randomness is enabled

Returns

The modified input images and the modified gt images

data_science_framework.pytorch_utils.data_manager.data_transformation.rotate_images(input_images: list, gt_images: list, angle_x: float = 0, angle_y: float = 0, angle_z: float = 0, random: bool = False) → Tuple[source]¶

Function that apply the same rotation to the two set of images

Parameters

  • input_images – List of input nifty images

  • gt_images – List of ground truth nifty images

  • angle_x – If random is enabled it corresponds to the max rotation angle around x axis otherwise it corresponds to the value of the rotation angle

  • angle_y – If random is enabled it corresponds to the max rotation angle around y axis otherwise it corresponds to the value of the rotation angle

  • angle_z – If random is enabled it corresponds to the max rotation angle around z axis otherwise it corresponds to the value of the rotation angle

  • random – True if randomness is enabled. In this case, the angle of rotation follows a uniforme distribution between -angle and angle for each direction

Returns

The modified input images and the modified gt images
